intro: Phyllorkis protracta, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and cranberries. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in coastal or inland regions. Phyllorkis protracta is adapted to harsh environments and is often found in heathlands and cliff faces.
